I was given the "good advice" to not take $100K in student loans, and luckily, went to a state school for almost nothing because of my test scores.

Much of the resentment among blue collar whites stems from the notion that their lives have been blessed by some all-encompassing privilege, particularly economically. The privilege of seeing your race represented on TV is little comfort to the white roughnecks and truck drivers and waitresses who've worked hard and never had much of anything handed to them. Pollsters don't set out to find an sample that's evenly split between Republicans and Democrats. If they did, their polls would usually be tied. What they try to find is a demographically representative sample of registered voters. One that resembles as closely as possible the age, gender, ethnicity, income, religion etc. makeup of the electorate as a whole. BTW, you're looking at the total sample instead of the downsized sample of registered voters below it. That's where the 9% lead comes from.
